bodydiv.p: In principle, an entity should use similar principles to those in IFRS 15 to separate performance obligations to provide goods and non-insurance services from the host contract, regardless of whether the host contract is within the scope of IFRS 17 or of IFRS 15. Accordingly, IFRS 17 requires entities to separate only the goods and services that are distinct from the provision of insurance coverage, consistent with the separation criteria in IFRS 15.
